trans-unit.source: Defines a mechanism for retrieving a service contract from a component.
The <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IServiceProviderContract> interface defines a contract that enables a component to obtain a custom service that is defined by another component.
A component that implements <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IServiceProviderContract> is known as a service provider.
Service providers implement the <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IServiceProviderContract.QueryService%2A> method to return an <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IContract> that implements a service.
Returns a service contract that is implemented by this <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.IServiceProviderContract"></xref>.
The formats of the strings that identify services and service contracts are defined by the <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IServiceProviderContract> implementation.

It is recommended that <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IServiceProviderContract> implementations identify a service contract by the <xref:System.Type.AssemblyQualifiedName%2A> property of the type that implements the service contract.
The name of the service that is being requested.
The service contract that is being requested.

An <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.IContract"></xref> that represents a service contract that a client is requesting from the <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.IServiceProviderContract"></xref>; `null` if the <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.IServiceProviderContract"></xref> does not implement the requested contract.
